acaps_comments: Sudan has extended its curfew for two weeks in an effort to curb the spread of the Covid-19 pandemic. The Security and Defence Council approved the extension of the curfew in the capital Khartoum until June 18. But it allowed for more movement in the city from 6am to 3pm on condition that residents adhere to safety and health regulations. | | | | non compliance: Up to detention
source: All Africa | source type: Media | link: https://allafrica.com/stories/202006040198.html |

acaps_comments: Sudan is extending a lockdown in the state of Khartoum aimed at curbing the spread of the new coronavirus by one week until July 7 | admin level name: Khartoum | | | non compliance: Not available
